members.name: selectionMode

`"multiple"` allows any number of selections,

`"single"` allows only one selection, and

`"single-persist"` allows one selection and prevents de-selection.

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

declarations.name: Alert
declarations.description:
Alerts are meant to provide a way to communicate urgent or important information to users, frequently as a result of an action they took in your app. Alerts are positioned
at the bottom of the page. Multiple opened alerts will be added to a queue, allowing users to dismiss them in the order they are provided.

members.name: autoClose
members.description: When `true`, the component closes automatically. Recommended for passive, non-blocking alerts.

members.name: autoCloseDuration
members.description: Specifies the duration before the component automatically closes - only use with `autoClose`.

members.name: componentOnReady
members.description: Create a promise that resolves once component is fully loaded.

docsTags.name: example

members.name: icon
members.description:
When `true`, shows a default recommended icon. Alternatively,
pass a Calcite UI Icon name to display a specific icon.

members.name: iconFlipRtl
members.description: When `true`, the icon will be flipped when the element direction is right-to-left (`"rtl"`).

members.name: kind
members.description: Specifies the kind of the component, which will apply to top border and icon.

members.name: label
members.description: Specifies an accessible name for the component.

members.name: messageOverrides
members.description: Use this property to override individual strings used by the component.

members.name: numberingSystem
members.description: Specifies the Unicode numeral system used by the component for localization.

members.description: When `true`, displays and positions the component.

members.description: Specifies the placement of the component.

members.name: queue
members.description: Specifies the ordering priority of the component when opened.

members.name: disabled
members.description: When `true`, interaction is prevented and the component is displayed with lower opacity.

members.name: flipPlacements
members.description: Specifies the component's fallback `placement` when it's initial or specified `placement` has insufficient space available.

members.name: form
members.description:
The `id` of the form that will be associated with the component.

When not set, the component will be associated with its ancestor form element, if any.

members.name: icon
members.description: When `true`, shows a default recommended icon. Alternatively, pass a Calcite UI Icon name to display a specific icon.

members.name: iconFlipRtl
members.description: When `true`, the icon will be flipped when the element direction is right-to-left (`"rtl"`).

members.name: inputValue
members.description: The component's input value.

members.name: label
members.description: Accessible name for the component.

members.name: loading
members.description: When `true`, a busy indicator is displayed.

members.name: maxLength
members.description:
When the component resides in a form,
specifies the maximum length of text for the component's value.

docsTags.name: mdn
docsTags.text: [maxlength](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#maxlength)

members.name: messageOverrides
members.description: Use this property to override individual strings used by the component.

members.name: minLength
members.description:
When the component resides in a form,
specifies the minimum length of text for the component's value.

docsTags.name: mdn
docsTags.text: [minlength](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#minlength)

members.name: name
members.description:
Specifies the name of the component.

Required to pass the component's `value` on form submission.

docsTags.name: mdn
docsTags.text: [name](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#name)

members.name: open
members.description: When `true`, displays and positions the component.

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

members.name: pattern
members.description:
When the component resides in a form,
specifies a regular expression (regex) pattern the component's `value` must match for validation.
Read the native attribute's documentation on MDN for more info.

docsTags.name: mdn
docsTags.text: [step](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/pattern)

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Specifies placeholder text for the component.

members.name: placement
members.description: Determines where the component will be positioned relative to the container element.

members.name: prefixText
members.description: Adds text to the start of the component.

members.name: readOnly
members.description: When `true`, the component's value can be read, but cannot be modified.

docsTags.name: mdn
docsTags.text: [readOnly](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/readonly)

members.name: reposition
members.description: Updates the position of the component.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: delayed - `true` if the placement should be updated after the component is finished rendering.

members.name: required
members.description:
When `true` and the component resides in a form,
the component must have a value in order for the form to submit.

members.name: scale
members.description: Specifies the size of the component.

members.name: scrollContentTo
members.description: Scrolls the component's content to a specified set of coordinates.

docsTags.name: example
param

docsTags.name: returns
docsTags.text: - promise that resolves once the content is scrolled to.

declarations.name: Button
declarations.description:
Passing a 'href' will render an anchor link, instead of a button. Role will be set to link, or button, depending on this.

It is the consumers responsibility to add aria information, rel, target, for links, and any button attributes for form submission

members.name: selectionMode
members.description:
Specifies the selection mode of the component, where:

`"multiple"` allows any number of selections,

`"single"` allows only one selection,

`"single-persist"` allows one selection and prevents de-selection, and

`"none"` does not allow any selections.

members.name: allowEmpty
members.description:
When `true`, an empty color (`null`) will be allowed as a `value`.

When `false`, a color value is enforced, and clearing the input or blurring will restore the last valid `value`.

members.description: When `true`, the component will allow updates to the color's alpha value.

members.name: channelsDisabled
members.description: When `true`, hides the RGB/HSV channel inputs.

members.name: clearable
members.description:
When `true`, an empty color (`null`) will be allowed as a `value`.

When `false`, a color value is enforced, and clearing the input or blurring will restore the last valid `value`.

members.description:
The component's value, where the value can be a CSS color string, or a RGB, HSL or HSV object.

The type will be preserved as the color is updated.

type.text: (HSL & ObjectWithAlpha) | (HSV & ObjectWithAlpha) | (RGB & ObjectWithAlpha) | HSL | HSV | RGB | string

attributes.name: allow-empty
attributes.description:
When `true`, an empty color (`null`) will be allowed as a `value`.

When `false`, a color value is enforced, and clearing the input or blurring will restore the last valid `value`.

attributes.name: alpha-channel
attributes.description: When `true`, the component will allow updates to the color's alpha value.

attributes.name: channels-disabled
attributes.description: When `true`, hides the RGB/HSV channel inputs.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description:
When `true`, an empty color (`null`) will be allowed as a `value`.

When `false`, a color value is enforced, and clearing the input or blurring will restore the last valid `value`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: When `true`, interaction is prevented and the component is displayed with lower opacity.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description:
The format of `value`.

When `"auto"`, the format will be inferred from `value` when set.

attributes.name: hex-disabled
attributes.description: When `true`, hides the hex input.

attributes.name: numbering-system
attributes.description: Specifies the Unicode numeral system used by the component for localization.

attributes.name: saved-disabled
attributes.description: When `true`, hides the saved colors section.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description: Specifies the size of the component.

attributes.name: storage-id
attributes.description: Specifies the storage ID for colors.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The component's value, where the value can be a CSS color string, or a RGB, HSL or HSV object.

The type will be preserved as the color is updated.

events.name: calciteColorPickerChange
events.description: Fires when the color value has changed.

events.name: calciteColorPickerInput
events.description:
Fires as the color value changes.

Similar to the `calciteColorPickerChange` event with the exception of dragging. When dragging the color field or hue slider thumb, this event fires as the thumb is moved.

members.name: maxItems
members.description: Specifies the maximum number of `calcite-combobox-item`s (including nested children) to display before displaying a scrollbar.

members.name: messageOverrides
members.description: Use this property to override individual strings used by the component.

members.name: name
members.description:
Specifies the name of the component.

Required to pass the component's `value` on form submission.

members.name: open
members.description: When `true`, displays and positions the component.

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Specifies the placeholder text for the input.

members.name: placeholderIcon
members.description: Specifies the placeholder icon for the input.

members.name: placeholderIconFlipRtl
members.description: When `true`, the icon will be flipped when the element direction is right-to-left (`"rtl"`).

members.name: readOnly
members.description: When `true`, the component's value can be read, but controls are not accessible and the value cannot be modified.

members.name: reposition
members.description: Updates the position of the component.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: delayed Reposition the component after a delay

docsTags.name: returns
docsTags.text: Promise

members.name: required
members.description:
When `true` and the component resides in a form,
the component must have a value in order for the form to submit.

members.name: scale
members.description: Specifies the size of the component.

members.name: selectAllEnabled
members.description: When `true` and `selectionMode` is `"multiple"` or `"ancestors"`, provides a checkbox for selecting all `calcite-combobox-item`s.

members.name: selectedItems
members.description: Specifies the component's selected items.

members.name: selectionDisplay
members.description:
When `selectionMode` is `"ancestors"` or `"multiple"`, specifies the display of multiple `calcite-combobox-item` selections, where:

`"all"` displays all selections with individual `calcite-chip`s,

`"fit"` displays individual `calcite-chip`s that scale to the component's size, including a non-closable `calcite-chip`, which provides the number of additional `calcite-combobox-item` selections not visually displayed, and

`"single"` displays one `calcite-chip` with the total number of selections.

members.name: selectionMode
members.description:
Specifies the selection mode of the component, where:

`"multiple"` allows any number of selections,

`"single"` allows only one selection,

`"single-persist"` allows one selection and prevents de-selection, and

`"ancestors"` allows multiple selections, but shows ancestors of selected items as selected, with only deepest children shown in chips.

members.name: setFocus
members.description: Sets focus on the component.

members.description: Specifies the status of the input field, which determines message and icons.

members.description: Specifies the validation icon to display under the component.

members.name: validationMessage
members.description: Specifies the validation message to display under the component.

members.name: validity
members.description: The current validation state of the component.

members.description: When `true` and `modal` is `false`, prevents focus trapping.

members.name: focusTrapOptions
members.description:
Specifies custom focus trap configuration on the component, where

`"allowOutsideClick`" allows outside clicks,
`"initialFocus"` enables initial focus,
`"returnFocusOnDeactivate"` returns focus when not active, and
`"extraContainers"` specifies additional focusable elements external to the trap (e.g., 3rd-party components appending elements to the document body).

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

Performs a filter on the component.

This method can be useful because filtering is delayed and asynchronous.

members.name: filterProps
members.description: Specifies the properties to match against when filtering. This will only apply when `value` is an object. If not set, all properties will be matched.

members.name: items
members.description:
Defines the items to filter. The component uses the values as the starting point, and returns items

that contain the string entered in the input, using a partial match and recursive search.

This property is needed to conduct filtering.

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

attributes.description: Adds text to the end of the component.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Specifies the component type.

Note that the following `type`s add type-specific icons by default: `"date"`, `"email"`, `"password"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"time"`.

 `"textarea"` [Deprecated] use the `calcite-text-area` component instead.

members.name: disabled
members.description: When `true`, interaction is prevented and the component is displayed with lower opacity.

members.name: flipPlacements
members.description: Specifies the component's fallback `calcite-date-picker` `placement` when it's initial or specified `placement` has insufficient space available.

members.name: focusTrapDisabled
members.description: When `true`, prevents focus trapping.

members.name: form
members.description:
The `id` of the form that will be associated with the component.

When not set, the component will be associated with its ancestor form element, if any.

members.name: headingLevel
members.description: Specifies the heading level of the component's `heading` for proper document structure, without affecting visual styling.

members.name: label
members.description: Accessible name for the component.

members.name: layout
members.description: Defines the layout of the component.

members.name: max
members.description:
When the component resides in a form,
specifies the latest allowed date ("yyyy-mm-dd").

members.name: maxAsDate
members.description: Specifies the latest allowed date as a full date object.

members.name: messageOverrides
members.description: Use this property to override individual strings used by the component.

members.name: min
members.description:
When the component resides in a form,
specifies the earliest allowed date ("yyyy-mm-dd").

members.name: minAsDate
members.description: Specifies the earliest allowed date as a full date object.

members.name: monthStyle
members.description: Specifies the monthStyle used by the component.

members.name: name
members.description:
Specifies the name of the component.

Required to pass the component's `value` on form submission.

members.name: numberingSystem
members.description: Specifies the Unicode numeral system used by the component for localization. This property cannot be dynamically changed.

members.name: open
members.description: When `true`, displays the `calcite-date-picker` component.

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

members.name: placement
members.description: Specifies the placement of the `calcite-date-picker` relative to the component.

members.name: proximitySelectionDisabled
members.description:
When `true`, disables the default behavior on the third click of narrowing or extending the range.
Instead starts a new range.

members.name: range
members.description: When `true`, activates a range for the component.

members.name: readOnly
members.description: When `true`, the component's value can be read, but controls are not accessible and the value cannot be modified.

docsTags.name: mdn
docsTags.text: [readOnly](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/readonly)

members.name: reposition
members.description: Updates the position of the component.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: delayed If true, the repositioning is delayed.

docsTags.name: returns
docsTags.text: void

members.name: mode
members.description:
This specifies the type of `value` and the associated options presented to the user:

Using `"offset"` will provide options that show timezone offsets.

Using `"name"` will provide options that show the IANA time zone names.

members.name: name
members.description:
Specifies the name of the component.

Required to pass the component's `value` on form submission.

members.name: offsetStyle
members.description:
Specifies how the offset will be displayed, where

`"user"` uses `UTC` or `GMT` depending on the user's locale,
`"gmt"` always uses `GMT`, and
`"utc"` always uses `UTC`.

This only applies to the `offset` mode.

members.name: open
members.description: When `true`, displays and positions the component.

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

members.name: readOnly
members.description: When `true`, the component's value can be read, but controls are not accessible and the value cannot be modified.

members.name: referenceDate
members.description:
This `date` will be used as a reference to Daylight Savings Time when creating time zone item groups.

It can be either a Date instance or a string in ISO format (`"YYYY-MM-DD"`, `"YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSZ"`).

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [Date.prototype.toISOString()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toISOString).

members.description:
The component's value, where the value is the time zone offset or the difference, in minutes, between the selected time zone and UTC.

If no value is provided, the user's time zone offset will be selected by default.

declarations.description:
Any attributes placed on <calcite-link> component will propagate to the rendered child

Passing a 'href' will render an anchor link, instead of a span. Role will be set to link, or link, depending on this.

It is the consumers responsibility to add aria information, rel, target, for links, and any link attributes for form submission

members.name: displayMode
members.description:
Specifies the nesting behavior of `calcite-list-item`s, where

`"flat"` displays `calcite-list-item`s in a uniform list, and

`"nested"` displays `calcite-list-item`s under their parent element.

 The parent component's behavior should follow throughout its child elements.

members.name: dragEnabled
members.description: When `true`, `calcite-list-item`s are sortable via a draggable button.

members.name: filteredData
members.description: The currently filtered `calcite-list-item` data.

members.description: The currently filtered `calcite-list-item`s.

members.description: When `true`, an input appears at the top of the component that can be used by end users to filter `calcite-list-item`s.

members.description: Specifies an accessible name for the filter input field.

members.name: filterPlaceholder
members.description: Placeholder text for the component's filter input field.

members.name: filterPredicate
members.description: Specifies a function to handle filtering.

members.name: filterProps
members.description: Specifies the properties to match against when filtering. If not set, all properties will be matched (label, description, metadata, value, group heading).

members.name: filterText
members.description: Text for the component's filter input field.

members.name: group
members.description:
The list's group identifier.

To drag elements from one list into another, both lists must have the same group value.

members.name: interactionMode
members.description:
Specifies the interaction mode of the component.

`"interactive"` allows interaction styling and pointer changes on hover

`"static"` does not allow interaction styling and pointer changes on hover

The `"static"` value should only be used when `selectionMode` is `"none"`.

members.name: label
members.description:
Specifies an accessible name for the component.

When `dragEnabled` is `true` and multiple list sorting is enabled with `group`, specifies the component's name for dragging between lists.

members.name: selectionMode

Specifies the selection mode of the component, where:

`"single"` allows only one selection,

`"single-persist"` allows one selection and prevents de-selection, and

`"none"` does not allow any selections.

members.name: focusTrapOptions
members.description:
Specifies custom focus trap configuration on the component, where

`"allowOutsideClick`" allows outside clicks,
`"initialFocus"` enables initial focus,
`"returnFocusOnDeactivate"` returns focus when not active, and
`"extraContainers"` specifies additional focusable elements external to the trap (e.g., 3rd-party components appending elements to the document body).

declarations.name: Notice
declarations.description:
Notices are intended to be used to present users with important-but-not-crucial contextual tips or copy. Because
notices are displayed inline, a common use case is displaying them on page-load to present users with short hints or contextual copy.
They are optionally closable - useful for keeping track of whether or not a user has closed the notice. You can also choose not
to display a notice on page load and set the "active" attribute as needed to contextually provide inline messaging to users.

members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

members.name: focusTrapOptions
members.description:
Specifies custom focus trap configuration on the component, where

`"allowOutsideClick`" allows outside clicks,
`"initialFocus"` enables initial focus,
`"returnFocusOnDeactivate"` returns focus when not active, and
`"extraContainers"` specifies additional focusable elements external to the trap (e.g., 3rd-party components appending elements to the document body).

members.name: referenceElement
members.description:
The `referenceElement` used to position the component according to its `placement` value.

Setting to an `HTMLElement` is preferred so the component does not need to query the DOM.

However, a string `id` of the reference element can also be used.

The component should not be placed within its own `referenceElement` to avoid unintended behavior.

events.name: calciteRadioButtonChange
events.description:
Fires only when the radio button is checked.  This behavior is identical to the native HTML input element.
Since this event does not fire when the radio button is unchecked, it's not recommended to attach a listener for this event
directly on the element, but instead either attach it to a node that contains all of the radio buttons in the group
or use the `calciteRadioButtonGroupChange` event if using this with `calcite-radio-button-group`.

members.name: focusTrapOptions
members.description:
Specifies custom focus trap configuration on the component, where

`"allowOutsideClick`" allows outside clicks,
`"initialFocus"` enables initial focus,
`"returnFocusOnDeactivate"` returns focus when not active, and
`"extraContainers"` specifies additional focusable elements external to the trap (e.g., 3rd-party components appending elements to the document body).

members.name: displayMode
members.description:
Specifies the display mode of the component, where:

`"dock"` displays at full height adjacent to center content,

`"overlay"` displays at full height on top of center content, and

`"float"` [Deprecated] does not display at full height with content separately detached from `calcite-action-bar` on top of center content.

`"float-content"` does not display at full height with content separately detached from `calcite-action-bar` on top of center content.

`"float-all"` detaches the `calcite-panel` and `calcite-action-bar` on top of center content.

members.description: Specifies the component's position. Will be flipped when the element direction is right-to-left (`"rtl"`).

members.name: width

`"float-all"` detaches the `calcite-panel` and `calcite-action-bar` on top of center content.

members.name: disabled
members.description: When `true`, interaction is prevented and the component is displayed with lower opacity.

members.name: fillPlacement
members.description:
Used to configure where the fill is placed along the slider track in relation to the value handle.

Range mode will always display the fill between the min and max handles.

members.name: form
members.description:
The `id` of the form that will be associated with the component.

When not set, the component will be associated with its ancestor form element, if any.

members.name: groupSeparator
members.description: When `true`, number values are displayed with a group separator corresponding to the language and country format.

members.name: hasHistogram
members.description: When `true`, indicates a histogram is present.

members.name: histogram
members.description: A list of the histogram's x,y coordinates within the component's `min` and `max`. Displays above the component's track.

docsTags.name: see
docsTags.text: [DataSeries](https://github.com/Esri/calcite-design-system/blob/dev/packages/calcite-components/src/components/graph/interfaces.ts#L5).

members.name: histogramStops
members.description: A set of single color stops for a histogram, sorted by offset ascending.

members.name: labelFormatter
members.description: When specified, allows users to customize handle labels.

type.text: (value: number, type: "min" | "max" | "value" | "tick", defaultFormatter: (value: number) => string) => string

members.name: labelHandles
members.description: When `true`, displays label handles with their numeric value.

members.name: labelTicks
members.description: When `true` and `ticks` is specified, displays label tick marks with their numeric value.

members.name: max
members.description: The component's maximum selectable value.

members.name: maxLabel
members.description: For multiple selections, the accessible name for the second handle, such as `"Temperature, upper bound"`.

members.name: maxValue
members.description: For multiple selections, the component's upper value.

members.name: min
members.description: The component's minimum selectable value.

members.name: minLabel
members.description: Accessible name for first (or only) handle, such as `"Temperature, lower bound"`.

members.name: minValue
members.description: For multiple selections, the component's lower value.

members.name: mirrored
members.description:
When `true`, the slider will display values from high to low.

Note that this value will be ignored if the slider has an associated histogram.

members.name: name
members.description:
Specifies the name of the component.

Required to pass the component's `value` on form submission.

members.name: numberingSystem
members.description: Specifies the Unicode numeral system used by the component for localization.

members.name: pageStep
members.description: Specifies the interval to move with the page up, or page down keys.

members.name: precise
members.description: When `true`, sets a finer point for handles.

members.name: required
members.description:
When `true` and the component resides in a form,
the component must have a value in order for the form to submit.

members.name: scale
members.description: Specifies the size of the component.

members.name: setFocus
members.description: Sets focus on the component.

members.name: snap
members.description: When `true`, enables snap selection in coordination with `step` via a mouse.

members.name: status
members.description: Specifies the status of the input field, which determines message and icons.

members.name: step
members.description: Specifies the interval to move with the up, or down keys.

members.name: ticks
members.description: Displays tick marks on the number line at a specified interval.

members.name: validationIcon
members.description: Specifies the validation icon to display under the component.

members.name: validationMessage
members.description: Specifies the validation message to display under the component.

members.name: validity
members.description: The current validation state of the component.

expensive operations consider using a debounce or throttle to avoid
locking up the main thread.

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

`"fixed"` should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

members.description: Offset the position of the component away from the `referenceElement`.

members.name: offsetSkidding
members.description: Offset the position of the component along the `referenceElement`.

members.name: open
members.description: When `true`, the component is open.

members.name: overlayPositioning
members.description:
Determines the type of positioning to use for the overlaid content.

Using `"absolute"` will work for most cases. The component will be positioned inside of overflowing parent containers and will affect the container's layout.

The `"fixed"` value should be used to escape an overflowing parent container, or when the reference element's `position` CSS property is `"fixed"`.

members.name: placement
members.description: Determines where the component will be positioned relative to the `referenceElement`.

members.name: referenceElement
members.description:
The `referenceElement` to position the component according to its `"placement"` value.

Setting to the `HTMLElement` is preferred so the component does not need to query the DOM for the `referenceElement`.

However, a string ID of the reference element can be used.

The component should not be placed within its own `referenceElement` to avoid unintended behavior.

members.name: reposition
members.description: Updates the position of the component.

`"ancestors"` displays with a checkbox and allows any number of selections from corresponding parent and child selections,

`"children"` allows any number of selections from one parent from corresponding parent and child selections,

`"single-persist"` allows and requires one selection.
